author: Jacob Gershman
title: Texas Church Shooter Was Ticking Time Bomb
text:
Five years before Air Force veteran Devin Patrick Kelley burst into a small church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, last fall with a legally purchased semiautomatic rifle and gunned down 26 people, he recorded a tearful confession.
“I am making this documentary, so everybody knows,” Kelley said in 2012, before describing how he pushed and struck his toddler stepson so hard, he fractured the child’s collarbone and caused bleeding on the brain. He violently lashed out when the boy spat out food, or when he grabbed things he wasn’t... RELATED VIDEO Multiple Churchgoers Killed in Texas Shooting Multiple people were killed after a shooter opened fire at a Baptist church in Sutherland Springs, Texas. Photo: Nick Wagner/Austin American-Statesman/AP (Originally published Nov. 6, 2017)
